unnormalised: Alright folks, here's a quick update on some important changes to how you can reach different government offices. This affects everyone, from those dealing with passport applications to those trying to get their property documents sorted.
normalised: Alright folks, here's a quick update on some important changes to how you can reach different government offices. This affects everyone, from those dealing with passport applications to those trying to get their property documents sorted.

unnormalised: First up, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has announced a change of address for its regional passport office in Chennai. Previously located at Haddows Road, Nungambakkam, the new address is now at Ispahani Centre, 123/124 Nungambakkam High Rd, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600034. Make sure you note that down if you're planning a visit! All passport related queries and applications should now be directed to this new location. Apparently, they shifted operations starting from 01/07/2024, so the old address is officially out of commission.
normalised: First up, the Ministry of External Affairs (M-E-A) has announced a change of address for its regional passport office in Chennai. Previously located at Haddows Road, Nungambakkam, the new address is now at Ispahani Centre, one hundred and twenty three divided by one hundred and twenty four Nungambakkam High Road, Chennai, Tamil Nadu six hundred thousand and thirty four. Make sure you note that down if you're planning a visit! All passport related queries and applications should now be directed to this new location. Apparently, they shifted operations starting from first July two thousand and twenty four, so the old address is officially out of commission.

unnormalised: Next, for all you students and academics, there's been a slight tweak in the address of the University Grants Commission (UGC) headquarters. While the main office still remains at Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, New Delhi, 110002, the contact number for the information center has been updated. The new contact number is 011-23236351, and you can now reach out to them for any queries regarding scholarships, affiliations, or other academic matters.
normalised: Next, for all you students and academics, there's been a slight tweak in the address of the University Grants Commission (U-G-C) headquarters. While the main office still remains at Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and two, the contact number for the information center has been updated. The new contact number is zero double one two three two three six three five one, and you can now reach out to them for any queries regarding scholarships, affiliations, or other academic matters.

unnormalised: Moving on, if you're dealing with anything related to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), remember that their regional office in Kolkata has updated its pin code. While the address remains the same at 15, Netaji Subhas Road, Kolkata, the new postal code is now 700001, previously it was showing as 700000. This seemingly small change can make a big difference when you're sending important documents, so be careful.
normalised: Moving on, if you're dealing with anything related to the Reserve Bank of India (R-B-I), remember that their regional office in Kolkata has updated its pin code. While the address remains the same at fifteen, Netaji Subhas Road, Kolkata, the new postal code is now seven hundred thousand and one, previously it was showing as seven hundred thousand. This seemingly small change can make a big difference when you're sending important documents, so be careful.

unnormalised: For those residing in Mumbai and dealing with property registrations, the Sub-Registrar Office in Bandra (West) has moved to a new building. The new address is now at CTS No. E/478, Linking Road, Bandra (W), Mumbai, 400050. Be mindful of this change because going to the old location, especially if you're pressed for time, can be a hassle. They made the shift effective 15/06/2024.
normalised: For those residing in Mumbai and dealing with property registrations, the Sub-Registrar Office in Bandra (West) has moved to a new building. The new address is now at C-T-S No. E slash four hundred and seventy eight, Linking Road, Bandra (W), Mumbai, four hundred thousand and fifty. Be mindful of this change because going to the old location, especially if you're pressed for time, can be a hassle. They made the shift effective fifteenth June two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: And lastly, a quick reminder for all you taxpayers. The Income Tax Department has streamlined its communication channels. While the address for sending physical documents to the Central Processing Unit (CPC) remains the same at Post Box No. 293, Bangalore, 560009, they are encouraging everyone to use online platforms for filing returns and addressing grievances. The helpline number is 1800-180-1961 for any assistance.
normalised: And lastly, a quick reminder for all you taxpayers. The Income Tax Department has streamlined its communication channels. While the address for sending physical documents to the Central Processing Unit (C-P-C) remains the same at Post Box No. two hundred and ninety three, Bangalore, five hundred and sixty thousand and nine, they are encouraging everyone to use online platforms for filing returns and addressing grievances. The helpline number is one eight hundred one hundred and eighty one thousand nine hundred and sixty one for any assistance.

unnormalised: Keep these updates in mind when you're corresponding with government institutions. A small change in the address or a pin code can sometimes create unnecessary delays. Stay informed, and it'll save you some headaches! Remember to double check all addresses on official websites before sending any important documents, things change faster than we can keep up with sometimes, eh?
normalised: Keep these updates in mind when you're corresponding with government institutions. A small change in the address or a pin code can sometimes create unnecessary delays. Stay informed, and it'll save you some headaches!
